derivation: or (Daniel 11:6) כּוֹחַ; from an unused root meaning to be firm;
outline:
1. strength, power, might
    1. human strength
    2. strength (of angels)
    3. power (of God)
    4. strength (of animals)
    5. strength, produce, wealth (of soil)
  2. a small reptile, probably a kind of lizard, which is unclean
    1. perhaps an extinct animal, exact meaning is unknown
kjv_def: ability, able, chameleon, force, fruits, might, power(-ful), strength, substance, wealth.
strongs_def: vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
